required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-Man Study of Sirolimus-eluting Iron Bioresorbable Coronary Scaffold System (IBS)

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a pilot clinical trial for Sirolimus-eluting Iron Bioresorbable Coronary Scaffold System（IBS）. The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility, preliminary safety and efficacy of IBS. To provide the basis for subsequent large-scale, multi-center, randomized controlled clinical trials of IBS.

primary_outcome.measure: Study Device related Composite Endpoint (Target Lesion Failure)
primary_outcome.description: Target Lesion Failure is defined as the composited endpoints of including cardiac death, Target vessel related myocardial infarction (TV-MI) and clinical indicated target lesion revascularization (CI-TLR), also known as MACE (major adverse cardiac events).

secondary_outcome.description: Device Success: Successfully transit and release the IBS at target lesion, then withdraw the delivery system. Immediate residual stenosis < 30% and TIMI blood flow is class 3 (visual). Lesion Success: Any method of intervention therapy, the residual stenosis of the target lesion < 30% and TIMI blood flow is class 3(visual).
Defined as based on lesion success, there is no major adverse cardiac events in the hospitalization period.
4 class (Excellent, good, general, bad) to evaluate the push ability, performance of through the lesions, performance of cover the lesions, support force, withdraw ability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 Month, 1 Year, 2 Years, 3 Years, 4 Years, 5 Years postprocedure
secondary_outcome.description: Target Lesion Failure, defined as the composited endpoints of including cardiac death, Target vessel related myocardial infarction (TV-MI) and clinical indicated target lesion revascularization (CI-TLR), also known as MACE (major adverse cardiac events).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 Month, 6 Months, 1 Year, 2 Years, 3 Years, 4 Years, 5 Years postprocedure]
secondary_outcome.description: Including all-cause mortality, all myocardial infarction and target lesion revascularization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Acute(0-24 hours), Subacute(24 hours-30 days), Late(30 days-1 year),Very late(after 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Timing (acute, sub-acute, late and very late) Evidence (definite and probable)

secondary_outcome.measure: In-stent, in-segment, proximal and distal minimum lumen diameter (MLD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate postoperative, 6 months, 1 year, 2 year, 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: In-stent, in-segment, proximal and distal Diameter stenosis(DS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate postoperative, 6 months, 1 year, 2 year, 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: In-stent, in-segment, proximal and distal Late lumen loss (LLL)
In-stent, in-segment, proximal and distal Angiographic defined restenosis (ABR)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the average diameter change of lumen diameter before and after using nitroglycerin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Morphometric, lesion composition and scaffold strut data obtained with OCT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate postoperative, 6 months, 1 year, 2 year, 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Vascular and scaffold morphology obtained with IVUS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate postoperative, 6 months, 1 year, 2 year, 3 years

arm_group.description: Implantation of IBS in patients with coronary artery lesions. All the subjects will be randomly assigned to queue 1 (n=30) and queue 2 (n=15)

intervention.intervention_name: Sirolimus-eluting Iron Bioresorbable Coronary Scaffold System
intervention.description: Implantation of Sirolimus-eluting Iron Bioresorbable Coronary Scaffold System (IBS)
